title: Napoli owner Aurelio De Laurentiis dismisses reports of a rift with unsettled coach Ancelotti
text:
Napoli owner Aurelio De Laurentiis has told unsettled coach Carlo Ancelotti he 'can stay for another 10 years.'

The Serie A contenders have not won the Italian title since 1990 and already trail leaders Juventus by six points after seven matches this season, having finished 11 points behind the champions in Ancelotti's first season in charge.

There were reports recently that Ancelotti could leave the club before the end of his contract if his players don't step up for a title challenge

Carlo Ancelotti is not happy at Napoli and could leave the club before the end of his contract

But De Laurentiis dismissed reports of a rift with the 60-year-old.

'In recent days I've seen it all in important newspapers, even if no-one reads newspapers anymore,' De Laurentiis told Sky Sport Italia.

'I didn't fight with Ancelotti, he can stay here for another 10 years. In cinema, my relationships, like my one with [director Carlo] Verdone, last a long time.

'I'm all for the exclusives, when you want everything right away but get it all wrong.'

Napoli chairman Aurelio De Laurentiis has dismissed reports of a rift with coach Ancelotti

De Laurentiis also told Lorenzo Insigne he must 'change his attitude' towards Ancelotti after the striker admitted the pair had been involved in fiery exchanges at training.

'Insigne's an excellent sportsman, but he must stay calm, change his attitude and lay off certain things. He's always had an attitude of discomfort in Naples. I understand him, I protect him and I like him a lot, but he's always found his situation in Naples to be uncomfortable.

'Therefore, I just want to say that he needs to calm down and become a more peaceful person, but that's his problem. Neither Raiola nor Ancelotti can resolve that.

'He's a great player and he can be in good form or bad form. If he's less so, it's up to the coach not to play him. Insigne can't come out cracking jokes or with an 'almost' defiant attitude. The Coach is a family man, 60 years old, and won't tell you to get lost because he's three times your age.'
description: Napoli owner Aurelio De Laurentiis has told unsettled coach Carlo Ancelotti he 'can stay for another 10 years.'
